episode_title: 221 - The One With the Two Bullies

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Everyone is there. Monica is watching stock prices on a business channel.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Monica, why are we watchin’ the business channel?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ’Cause I was going by it the other day and I saw that there was a stock with my initials, MEG, on it and, well, sometimes I have to watch for two or three hours before it comes up again but when it does, it’s pretty exciting.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok honey, you really need a job.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mon, speaking of which, dad says he knows someone you can call for an interview.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, right there. That, that’s the third sign today. Right there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: On behalf of everyone, I’d just like to say behuh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, ’cause you just said dad and everywhere I go today I keep getting signs telling me to go see my father. Like when I was walking over here and I passed a buffet…which is my father’s last name.

content.speaker: Everyone
content.text: Ahh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And they were serving franks which is his first name minus the s at the end. And there was a rotisserie with spinning chicken.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: His indian name?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No because I chickened out the last time when I tried to meet him. So I mean coincidences? I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Freakish.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Freaky.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Weird, weird.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, so uh, who wants the last hamburger?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, alright, that’s it, now I have to go see him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hamburger. McDonald’s. Old MacDonald had a farm, my dad is a pharmacist.

content.description: Central Perk. Chandler and Ross enter in sweats carrying rackets.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Man, I am so beat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you just wanna forget about raquetball and hang out here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah alright.
[they sit at the couch]

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: [walks back from the counter] Hey you’re in our seats.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, sorry we didn’t know.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: [walks back from the counter] Hey, we were sitting there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, there is one more way to say it, who knows it?

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Is that supposed to be funny?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No actually, I was just going for colorful.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: What’s with this guy?

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: What’s with you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, nothing, nothing’s with him. Enjoy your coffee.
[as they’re walking off, little bully grabs Chandlers hat from behind and puts it on himself]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What just happened?

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: I just took your hat. See, I can be funny too. My, my joke is that I, I took your hat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That, that is funny. Can I have it back?

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, ok, you know what? I think you’re very funny. Kudos on that hat joke. But, come on guy just, just give him back the hat.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Why should we?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because it’s a special hat. [Chandler looks at Ross funny] See he bought it ’cause he was feeling really down one day so he got the hat to cheer himself up, ya know. Now Chandler…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stop talking, stop talking now. Let me just get this straight. You’re actually stealing my hat?

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: You got a problem with that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, just wanna make sure we’re on the same page.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Joey and Rachel are sitting there and Monica walks in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, how’d the interview go?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It bit. It was a 50’s theme restraunt. I have to cook in a costume and dance on the counter. I mean I was a chef at Cafe des Artistes. I mean how could I take a job where I have to make something called Laverne and Curly Fries?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So don’t do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How can I not do it? I have $127 in the bank.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica, relax, go get a beer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t want a beer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who said it was for you?

content.speaker: Ross and Chandler
content.text: [both enter looking down] Hhhiiii.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s the matter with you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The mean guys at the coffee house took my hat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re kiddin’.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was ridiculous. Ya know, these guys, they were bullies, actual bullies, ya know. We’re grown ups, this kinda stuff isn’t supposed to happen anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oohhh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. [Ross turns to Rachel and they hug]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohhh [turns as if to hug someone] Oh no, wait a minute, I have no one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, woah, let’s go down there and get your hat back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Na, forget it, it’s probably stripped and sold for parts by now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [seeing TV] Hey, I went up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My stock, MEG, it went up 2 points. Hey guys, do you realize that if I had invested my $127 in myself yesterday that I’d like have…a lot more than that today. Ya know what, I’m gonna do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Put all my money in me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, what are you talking about? You don’t know the first thing about the stock market.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s to know? Buy sell, high low, bears bulls…[on the phone] Yes Manhattan…yeah telephone number of the stock…selling store.

content.description: Phoebe’s dad’s house. Phoebe pulls up in the cab with Rachel and Joey in the back.

content.text: [Phoebe slams on the breaks. Joey and Rachel are thrown forward into the pillows in their laps.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See, didn’t I tell ya these pillows would be a good idea?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God, here we go. For the first time in my life I’m gonna say ‘Hi birthfather’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We love you, we’re here for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah good luck, good luck.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks. [gets out of the cab]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Rach, you uh, you want some sandwich?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, what is in that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Olive loaf and ham spread, no mayo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No no, ’cause mayo, that would make it gross.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [a little dog starts attacking her leg] Hey, hey, no, oh oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Run Phoebe run.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No no no, doggie please. Oh, I do so wanna love all animals, please no.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get him a bone, get a bone. You gotta bone?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you kidding me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look kibbles, bits. Oh God, alright, get the hell off my leg you yippity piece of crap. [Flings the dog off and jumps in the cab. The dog keeps jumping up to the window.] Ok, alright, we have a problem.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well why don’t you just reach out and take his trampoline.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, here, I know what we can do. [grabs Joey’s sadwich and throws it out the window]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey, hey no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, doggie get the- aahhh. Ok go get the sandwich, get the sandwich doggie. [dog ignores the sandwich] Good doggie get the sandwich, get the…ok, Joey, the dog will lick himself but he will not touch your sandwich, what does that say?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well if he’s not gonna eat it, I will.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you crazy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebs, he’s just a little dog. [turns back to the car window and the dog is halfway through it.] Ahhh.

content.description: Central Perk. Chandler and Ross are sitting at the couch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you have to be a Century 21 real-estate agent to get to wear those really cool jackets?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you say this stuff to girls?

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Hehehehey, isn’t that the guy who used to wear your hat?

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: And look where they’re sitting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re joking, right? You guys just walked through the door.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Maybe we didn’t make it clear enough.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: This couch belongs to us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, I’ll tell you what, you call the couch and then, and then we’ll call the couch, and we’ll see who it comes to.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: You know what I keep wondering? Why you two are still sitting here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, that’s it. I’ve had enough of this, alright. Gunther, these guys are trying to take our seat.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Fellas, these guys were here first.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Oh, sorry, I didn’t realize.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: There you go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you Gunther. We didn’t want to have to go and do that.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: He told on us?

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: You told on us?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well pal, you didn’t give me much of a choice. [flicks the ends of the big bully’s tie]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t play with his things.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Alright, let’s take this outside.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let’s, let’s take this outside? Who talks like that?

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: The guy that’s about to kick your ass talks like that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You had to ask.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.
[the bullies grab the back of the couch that Ross and Chandler are sitting in and tip back]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, ok look, see, the thing is we’re, we’re not gonna fight you guys.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Well then here’s the deal, you won’t have to so long as never ever show your faces in this coffee house ever again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think you played the Gunther card too soon.

content.description: Back in the cab in front of Phoebe’s dad’s house.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Phoeb’s, I think you’re good to go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just think that this was a really bad sign, ya know. I mean, like the beast at the threshold, you know. It’s just like, I have no family left, ya know. I mean except for my grandmother, you know, but let’s face it, she’s not gonna be around forever, despite what she says. And I have a sister who I’ve barely spoken to since we like shared a womb. I don’t know, this is my real father and I just, I want things to be like just right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah Phoebe, I completely understand.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, whatever you need. Hey, you wanna go home?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, thanks. Sorry, again
[She starts the cab and pulls forward. We hear a squish and a dog yelp.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [innocently] What was that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, I’m guessing the threshold’s clear now.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Joey is eating breakfast, Rachel has just gotten up, and Monica is on the phone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wanna buy 5 shares of SGJ and I wanna buy them now. C’mon time is money my friend. Thank you. Wooo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Time is money my friend?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you missed, ‘Takes money to make money,’ and uh, ’don’t make me come down there and kick your wall street butt.’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, I made $17 before breakfast, what have you done?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well uh, I had breakfast here so technically I saved $3.50.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How did you make $17.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, my financially challenged friends, I split my money and I bought some shares of CHP and ZXY.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How come those?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, CHP because I used to have a crush on Eric Estrada. And ZXY becuase I think it sounds zexy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What happened to uh, MEG.?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: MEG was good for me but I dumped her. Ya know, my motto is get out before they go down.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That is so not my motto.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [enters] Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Phoebs. Oh hey, how’s the dog?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, I talked to the vet, people are so nice upstate. Anyway, he said that the little fella’s gonna be ok and I can pick him up tomorrow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thank God.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but he did have to have a bunch of stitches and he said that only once in a blue moon does a dog’s ear grow back so…still hoping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, so Phoebe, now are you gonna call your dad and let him know that his dog is ok?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I, I don’t wanna meet my father over the phone. What am I gonna say, like ‘Hi, I’m Phoebe, the daughter you abandoned. Oh, by the way, I broke your dog.’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Phoebs, if you want, I’ll do it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok. Listen, just don’t say anything about me, ok. [goes over and grabs the phone that’s sitting by Monica]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: DOn’t …be too long with the phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She’ll be a much better friend when the market closes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [dials the phone] It’s a woman.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So talk to her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [in a fake voice] Uhh, hello Miss Buffay. I know where your dog is. I want you to know that he’ll be returned to you, almost as good as new, within, within 24 hours. Uh, goodbye. [hangs up]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why the voice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [in the voice] Hard to say.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Ross is sitting at the bar, Chandler serves up two mugs of hot water.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your cappucino sir.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.
[they both pour in packets of cappucino mix]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ya know I think this is much better than the coffee house.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Absolutely.
[they both stir thier coffee and proceed to stare into the mugs]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How come it’s not mixing with the water?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well the package says you have to uh, constantly keep it moving. Stir and drink, stir and drink, never let it settle.
[they both try to drink while continuously stirring]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [walks out of his room] Hey, this is ridiculous. I’ll tell you what. After I get back from my neice’s christening, I’ll go down to the coffee house with you and we’ll all have a nice cup of coffee alright. No problem, Joey’s there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. Man I don’t wanna have to have Joey with me every time I wanna descent cup of coffee. Ya know, and I don’t wanna spend the rest of my life drinking cappucino with a ‘K’. I say you and I go back down there and stand up to those guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, hang on a second there Custer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah really, Ross, have you ever been beaten up before?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, sure.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: By someone besides Monica?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. So what. So what if we get beaten up, maybe that’s just something every man has to go through once in his life. Ya know, like a, like a right of passage or somethin’.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, couldn’t we just lose our virginities again? Ya know, because I think actually mine’s growing back.

content.description: Outside Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Rachel is returning.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [Opens the door] I need to borrow a hundred bucks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, welcome home. [pulls Rachel inside] I need to borrow a hundred bucks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: For what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ve gotta get back in the game.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why, when did you get out of the game?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know, I lost it all ok. I lost it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, I’ve come to terms with it, you have to too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok. Look uhh, Mon I’m, I’m really sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, where are we on the hundred bucks?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I, I don’t have it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But I need it. Otherwords I’m gonna have to take that horrible diner job. You know, with the dancing and the costumes. I don’t wanna have to wear flame retardant boobs.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nobody does honey.

content.description: Phoebe’s dad’s house. Phoebe is returning the dog who is bandaged up and has a plastic cone around it’s neck.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Mrs. Buffay
content.text: Schnoodle. Oh my God, what the hell happened to my dog?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It was an accident, and, and the woman who did this would never ever hurt a dog on purpose. She’s a vegetarian.

content.speaker: Mrs. Buffay
content.text: What are these, stitches?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, eight of them. That’s 56 to him. You know also, if, if it’s raining, you can’t let him look up too long ’cause that cone’ll fill up really really fast.

content.speaker: Mrs. Buffay
content.text: Yeah well, thanks for bringing back what’s left of him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure, oh, is, is Frank home.

content.speaker: Mrs. Buffay
content.text: How do you know Frank?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just from a, from a long time ago. Is he here?

content.speaker: Mrs. Buffay
content.text: Yeah. Frank.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah. What? [a young guy comes around the corner]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, ok, um, I mean Frank senior.

content.speaker: Mrs. Buffay
content.text: He went out for groceries.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok so will he be back soon?

content.speaker: Mrs. Buffay
content.text: Well he left four years ago so we’re expecting him back any minute now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, I’m, I’m gonna go. I’m sorry about the dog, everything. I’m sorry.
[she turns to leave, Frank follows]

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey lady. Hey wait up. How do you know my dad?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um well I don’t really. Just genetically. He’s kinda my dad too.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Heavy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. So um, did he ever talk about me, Phoebe?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: No but he didn’t really talk about anything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Except stilts.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Stilts?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, he loved stilts. One time I was upstairs, I was stealing cigarettes out of my mom’s purse, and uh, all of a sudden I look over and there’s my dad’s head bobbing past the window. He just had this big smile on his face and he was waving ’cause he was always happiest when he was on his stilts.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know what to do with that.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Me neither. So you’re like my big sister.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: This is huge, you can buy me beer.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m not gonna. But you know what’s cool though? Ok, if you had a friend named Pete, then I could say, ‘Oh yeah, I know Pete, he’s friends with my brother.’

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: I gotta friend named Mark.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’ll work too.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Cool, alright. So maybe, ya know, I could give you a call sometime, we could talk or somethin’.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, that’d be ok.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Alright.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, I’m in the book.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Ok, yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright. So um, stilts huh?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah hey, you know if you want I can take you around back and show you where he hit his head on the rain gutter.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok.

content.description: Central Perk. Chandler and Ross are sitting on the couch nervously.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well we did it, we’re here. We are standing our ground. How long does a cup of coffee take?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you come on! Come on! [waitress brings their coffee] Thank you.
[They rush to put the cream and sugar in their cups and gulp down a few drinks]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, there we go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think we proved our point.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You burn your mouth?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cannot feel my tounge.
[They leave. As they’re walking out, the bullies are walking in.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bullies, big bullies.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Oh, look who’s here, it’s the weenies.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Did we not make ourselves clear the other day.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, and that’s why we’re here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, we’re standing out ground…apparently.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Let’s do this alright.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Woah, ho-ho, whad’ya got there, a weapon?

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: It’s a nice watch, I don’t wanna break it on your ribs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, let’s do this.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Alright.
[they all put up their fists and prepare to fight]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Question. If I don’t care about my watch, can I use it as a weapon?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whad’ya mean?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s sharp, it’s metal, I think I can do some, you know, serious damage with it.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: No, you can’t use your watch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok. [reaches in his pocket]

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Or your keys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Look, here’s what we’ll do. We’ll put all keys and watches in the hat over there. Alright. [they all put their keys and watches in the hat and put it on a mail box] Alright, c’mon man, let’s do this.
[they all jump in the street and prepare to fight]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Before I forget, are we hitting faces?

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Of course we’re hitting faces, why wouldn’t you hit faces?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well because I have to work on Monday, I have a big presentation.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Actually, you know, uh, I gotta show this apartment tomorrow and uh, you know, this no faces thing might not be a bad idea.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Ok, nothing from the neck up. [everyone gets ready for the fight] Or the waist down. Dana’s ovulating.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Oh really, you guys tryin’ again?

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, so let me just get this straight. So we’re uh, strictly talking about the middle?

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: C’mON!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey, woah, you want some of this, huh? You want a piece of this, huh? I’m standin here, huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, hey, those guys are takin our stuff! [some guy runs off with the hat]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Hey.
[they all run off after the guy]

content.description: Central Perk. The four guys are returning after getting the hat back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: God, that was, that was amazing, that was incredible. You guys, you guys kicked butt.

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: Us, what about you guys? Man you really, bing, gave it to old Mr. Clean back there. He was a big guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah he was wasn’t he.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I wouldn’t know having missed everything.

content.speaker: Big Bully
content.text: Don’t do that to yourself. Any one of us could have tripped over that little girls jump-rope.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, listen guys, are we uh, are we ok here?

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: We’re ok.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok so, can I have my hat back?

content.speaker: Little Bully
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh. [reaches over and grabs the hat and bolts for the door but slips and falls behind the couch]

content.description: The 50’s theme cafe. Monica is working the grill, the rest are at a table.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look at her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi Monica.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He-he-he, how’s it goin’?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey nice boobs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guys guys, check this out.

[Chandler puts a coin in the mini jukebox at the table. YMCA starts playing and Monica and the rest of the staff have to get on the counter and start singing along and dancing. After a couple of couruses, Chandler pulls out a handful of coins and drops them on the table.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Excellent.
